nosotros.description: At Bardelhaus, we are engineers passionate about technology, development, and education. We have over 5 years of experience in application management, in Moodle, leading technological management and innovation processes in courses and educational resources, and developing quality websites and applications.

serviceItem.servDescription: Development of web pages and landing pages.

projectItem.modalContent:
For this project, the best platform to use was evaluated and defined according to the new course Marketplace model, some of the tasks developed were:

  1. The Inandina website is integrated with Moodle, so that when a purchase is generated through it, the user is automatically enrolled in the course.
  2. The structure of the self-directed courses is designed and assembled in Moodle.
  3. Automatic configuration block is designed and implemented for Moodle resources.

    Note: This development was restructured and is located in a github repository

  4. Automatic generation of certificates with QR after the end of the course.
  5. Space to validate certificate authenticity.
Images

For this project, a proposed structure for an automated course was designed, maintaining the line of the structure used in current UNAD courses. In addition, the automated course has been implemented and configured, and a chatbot has been successfully integrated into it that greets you in a personalized way, and is capable of resolving questions related to the course and providing routes to some spaces within the course.

For this project, the microcurricular and instructional design of three (3) online and offline virtual courses was made with a duration of 12 hours each. The topics addressed in these courses are: 1. Home automation 2. Digital literacy 3. Oceans and hydrobiological resources.

Some of the tasks developed were:

  1. Curriculum mesh design, course technical sheet and teaching guide.
  2. Completion of scripts in accordance with the mesh proposal.
  3. Generate questionnaires for the three (3) content modules and final evaluation.
  4. Define four (4) challenges (practical part) with their respective guide.
